definition: ups and downs (of life etc)/to drift along/to sink and emerge
to float/superficial/floating/unstable/movable/provisional/temporary/transient/impetuous/hollow/inflated/to exceed/superfluous/excessive/surplus
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
see 黑沉沉[hei1 chen1 chen1]

sentences.english: Modem novelettes have experieced some ups and downs in their adaption into movies.
sentences.chinese: 当代中篇小说和电影改编之间的历史关系几历浮沉。

sentences.english: The float-sink effect is the mechanical mechanism for the formation and'exhumation of UHP rocks.
sentences.chinese: “浮沉子效应”是超高压岩石形成和折返的力学机制。

sentences.english: For my loved ones. I could not go down with those waves.
sentences.chinese: 我不能随波浮沉，为了我致爱的亲人。

sentences.english: Life has its ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 人的一生中难免有浮沉之时。

sentences.english: I cannot along with the wave vicissitude, for I send the family member who loves.
sentences.chinese: 我不能随波浮沉，为了我致爱的亲人。

sentences.english: It is rare even in Hollywood to find a star that rose and fell so quickly.
sentences.chinese: 即使在好莱坞也很少看到有明星浮沉如此之快。

sentences.english: The key issue lies in water stopping and lifting and floating the caissons.
sentences.chinese: 施工关键是止水处理及起浮沉箱。

sentences.english: That man plunged in the river but not to save the child.
sentences.chinese: 那个人在河中浮沉但是救不了那个孩子。

sentences.english: The swimming raft was dancing in the waves.
Dick shouted, up and down in the river.
sentences.chinese: 迪克在水里浮沉这大喊。

definition: lit. sinking and floating/to bob up and down on water/ebb and flow/fig. rise and fall/ups and downs of fortune/vicissitudes
uninhibited/free and unconstrained/rhythmical
floating in the wind/swaying/tottering/unstable
changeable situation (idiom)
to drift with the waves
destitute/difficulty/hardship/trouble
coming together and separating/aggregation and dissipation
joys and sorrows/partings and reunions/the vicissitudes of life
duckweed
to rise and fall/takeoff and landing/ups and downs
variant of 飄零|飘零[piao1 ling2]
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
variant of 飄盪|飘荡[piao1 dang4]
officialdom/bureaucracy
affairs of life/things of the world
(Buddhism) the world of the living
